alert.note: Alert for Davidson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 03 at 11:46AM CST until March 03 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN DAVIDSON...CENTRAL RUTHERFORD...SOUTHEASTERN SUMNER AND WILSON COUNTIES... At 1145 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mount Juliet to Smyrna to 7 miles west of Murfreesboro, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Gallatin, Lebanon, Hendersonville, Smyrna, La Vergne, Mount Juliet, Nolensville, Lakewood, Watertown, Hermitage, Walterhill, Rural Hill, Belinda City, Old Hickory, Green Hill, Lascassas, Tuckers Crossroads, Bledsoe Creek State Park and Dickerson Chapel Recreation Area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 218 and 247. Interstate 24 between mile markers 62 and 80. Interstate 840 between mile markers 46 and 76. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for Middle Tennessee. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CST for Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
